p: Low observed rates of bacterial and fungal infection in COVID-19 have also been reported from other countries, including the UK. Hughes and colleagues identified bacterial infection in 51/836 (6%) COVID-19 patients admitted to two London hospitals.[ 9] Secondary bacterial infection was uncommon in this cohort. Of 60 positive blood cultures, 39/60 (65%) were deemed to be contaminants, the majority being coagulase negative staphylococci.[ 9].
